alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 4:56PM MST until December 26 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SUNDAY TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and west central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 AM Sunday to 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
